intro: Platea latifolia var. sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran broadleaf platea, is a tropical plant native to the Indonesian island of Sumatra. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
